text: Syria competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Syria entered two swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Omar Abbas |align=left|200 m freestyle |1:52.78 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m freestyle |colspan=2| |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Ayman Kelzi |align=left|100 m butterfly |55.15 |50 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:00.59 |31 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:2019 in Syrian sport Category:Syria at the World Aquatics Championships
title: Syria at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
